title: Samsung Grassroots Football Academy
description: Join the Samsung Grassroots Football Academy this summer & learn how to take your club to the next level. Visit Samsung KX to find out more.

components.copy: Show off your club and creativity to join the Grassroots Academy

text: Grassroots football is a lifeline for communities up and down the country, but with more than 5,000 clubs at risk of closure*, its survival is under threat. We’ve partnered with Baiteze FC to help empower clubs across the nation and raise their game through creativity and tech.
The Grassroots Academy will teach you to win hearts, fans, likes and followers while taking control of your club’s future.

We’re looking for 5 clubs to join the academy this summer. Just show us your club in the most creative way, all wrapped up in a 60 second film. You could show us an original celebration, your best goals and tricks, your fans, your culture, your larger-than-life characters or anything else that you believe shows off your club in a unique way.
Just share your video on Instagram using #SamsungGrassroots by 25th July 2022 to be in with a chance of winning a place.
Don’t have Instagram but still want to join, get in touch here.

Over the summer, winners will have exclusive access to a programme of virtual masterclasses and workshops held in London. You’ll learn to harness the power of your club and elevate your brand through creativity and tech. FA Sunday Cup winners Baiteze FC and experts from the football and tech world will show you how to create epic content and how to build your community. You’ll also receive a Samsung Galaxy S22 Ultra smartphone and Samsung Z Fold3 for your club to capture all of your content.
You bring your club, passion and creativity. We’ll bring the tech, elevation and empowerment to unlock your potential.
Available to all UK-based, adult football clubs registered with the County Football Association (or other body affiliated with the FA).
You must be able to participate in the programme in August, September and October 2022, including attending two in person sessions in London.
<sup>*Source: The Final Whistle for Grassroots Football, 2021.</sup>
